title: Joker banks nearly $464 MILLION rivaling money made by Avengers: Infinity War
text:
Joker is on track to be the highest highest grossing R-rated movie of all time ahead of Deadpool 2 after banking nearly $464 million and rivaling the money made by Avengers: Infinity War.

The Joaquin Phoenix led film is set to make nearly half a billion in profit, coming close to the money made by the Marvel movie, Deadline reports, and that of Black Panther which hit $476.8 million.

By the end of its fourth weekend it is expected to hit $825 million in box office sales worldwide, as film lovers flock to see Phoenix portray Arthur Fleck, the embattled clown who later transforms into Batman's most iconic nemesis.

Its total earnings currently stand at around $737 million. Record-holder Deadpool 2 grossed $785 million.

Joker is on track to be the highest highest grossing R-rated movie of all time

Avengers: Infinity War made a half-billion dollars last year. The Joaquin Phoenix led film is set to make nearly that in profit and is expected to hit $825 million in box office sales worldwide by the end of its fourth weekend

Record-holder Deadpool 2 grossed $785 million. Joker already scored an October box-office record for Thursday showings with whopping $13.3 million, Warner Bros. revealed at the beginning of the month and had the best ever opening at the October domestic box office

And with production costs at a reported $70 million and global marketing and advertising at $120 million, current projections say it could hit $900 million gross in the next few weeks.

If it hits that target then Joker will also become the fourth most successful DC Comics film ever.

Actress Zazie Beetz, who starred in both Deadpool 2 and Joker, told The Hollywood Reporter: 'I think it's funny because they are inherently completely different in terms of production and how everything came together.'

She added: 'One is an action comedy, and the other one is a psychological drama. While Deadpool is still an R-rated story, there's a youthfulness to it that Joker doesn't have.'

Joker already scored an October box-office record for Thursday showings with whopping $13.3 million, Warner Bros. revealed at the beginning of the month and had the best ever opening at the October domestic box office with $96 million.

The movie, directed by Todd Phillips, got an eight-minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival.

The Joaquin Phoenix led film is set to make nearly half a billion in profit, coming close to the money made by the Marvel movie and that of Black Panther, pictured, which hit $476.8M

But it was at the center of controversy including potential security threats at showings.

Fears about about Joker's violent themes had caused many theater chains to ban costumes and authorities in numerous cities stepped up police patrols around theaters.

But the security concerns certainly did not put off audiences.
